description: <p>An exciting opportunity has arisen for a role as a Specialist Respiratory Physiotherapist at Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital. This is a full time position 37.5 hours, currently Monday to Friday with overnight on call and weekend working. There are plans to develop the therapy teams into providing a seven day service in the future. The post holder will provide respiratory care and post-operative rehabilitation across critical care and the surgical wards , as well as undertaking a team leader role in supporting and developing the service. There will also be opportunities for on-going clinical and managerial development with senior teaching and support for CPD and internal/external courses. Summary of the role: 1. To be the team lead for the respiratory physiotherapy service for critical care and surgery at Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital. 2. Be autonomously responsible for assessing and treating own clinical caseload and defining and implementing individualised programmes of care. 3. To work as a member of the multidisciplinary team (MDT), assessing and treating patients with respiratory problems and/or requiring physical rehabilitation, including complex cases, and maintain accurate and comprehensive patient records. 4. To be responsible for the development and appraisal of team members, including Band 5 & 6s, non-qualified staff and Students, to ensure best practice and patient care. This will also include ensuring competency of staff to work on the on-call and late rotas. 5. To regularly provide formal and informal, on-going training and education to therapy staff, medics, other healthcare professionals and students. 6. To engage in own continued professional development (CPD) and service development, in conjunction with the Clinical Specialist/Consultant as appropriate. 7. Lead on clinical audit and research within the Respiratory Physiotherapy Service. 8. To participate in the over night on call and weekend working rota Please contact Hannah Rooney on 0151 6001034 or Sue Sutton on 0151 6001953 for further information or to discuss informal visit options.</p>
